LT:   Use trigonometric equations to model real-world periodic behavior.
Interpret period and amplitude in context.

LT #3: I understand and can apply the inverse trig functions (ie sin-1), can evaluate inverse trigonometric functions using a calculator and determine exact values of composite functions with inverse trigonometric functions.

I understand the graphs of y=tan x, y = cot x, y = sec x, y = csc x and can apply variations to those graphs (stretches, compressions and translations)

Understand that sine, cosine, and tangent are functions that input angles and output ratios of specific sides in right triangles.
Given one trigonometric ratio, find the other two trigonometric ratios.

Understand that the angles in a right triangle are determined by the ratio of the side
